column4: Anyone know how to remove launchers from the panel in Gnome3 fallback mode?
ADD MORE LAUNCHERS. Start crying. I had the same thing. :\
My solution? I ignored it and slowly making a switch to different environment.
I know the nuclear option of how to get rid of them.
Remove Gnome3?
remove your user dconf file
~/.config/dconf/user
They must have been smoking something the day they made dconf binary format.
I get the same feeling when Vista first came out. (So I made the switch to linux). And now Gnome3 is doing this! :(
I have considered switching environments.
They did the same shit, though not this bad, with Gnome2.
Language. It's the policy here. .__.
:P
I love Gnome2. Now I'm using AwesomeWM. I need more time to absorb shortcuts.
Sadly it takes them years to get it right. When they do, they are bored, so they start over. :\
If it isn't broken, don't try to fix it. Also, it seems like everybody is always trying to reinvent the wheel and call it the new thing.
Not invented here syndrome.
I think that was nautilus, which can be brought back
you need gnome-tweak-tool, and then set file manager | have file manager handle the desktop | on
then run nautilus. I just tried it, it let me change my background.
I like gconf-editor better. I'm just going to walk away from this cesspool. :)
gconf-editor = dconf-editor now
